title: Pontiac Correctional Center phone & email directory

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pontiac Correctional Center phone & email directory
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I hope this request finds you in good spirits.
I request that a copy of the following documents [or documents containing the following information] be provided to me that pertains to Pontiac Correctional Center:  

Telephone directory of all current Pontiac Correctional Center employees and staff.

Email directory of all current Pontiac Correctional Center employees and staff.

Comprehensive list of current phone numbers, extensions, and corresponding names. If possible, please include position titles of each extension.  For example, extension 6226 is Family Liaisons (position title) and directs the caller to Natalie Mason (name).

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn

title: Live Birth Data by School District

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Live Birth Data by School District
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to make a Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for information regarding the number of live births in each school district in New York State from January 1st, 2019 to the present date.

I understand that this information may be maintained by the New York State Department of Health, and I am specifically requesting that you provide me with that data. If any other entity within your jurisdiction maintains this information, please let me know so that I may direct my request appropriately.

Please provide this information in a machine-readable format (such as .CSV or Excel) if possible. If not, please explain why and provide the information in another accessible format.

I would also like to receive a certification, as required by Public Officers Law §89(3), stating that all public records responsive to this request have been searched and reviewed, that any record that can be located has been made available to me, and that the specific grounds for any denial of access are clearly explained.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Live Birth Data by School District
communications.communication:
Thank you for your response to my Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for live birth data in New York State. While I appreciate the links you provided to the available data summaries, I would like to request all draft information and statistical tabulations and data for the years from 2019 to the present that you have readily available now.

I am aware that the New York State Department of Health has a legal obligation to respond to my request within 20 business days, as required by the FOIL law. If the department anticipates that it will be unable to provide the requested information within that time frame, I ask that you notify me in writing and provide an explanation for the delay, as well as a new estimated timeline for providing the responsive records.

Additionally, please be advised that any unreasonable delay or denial of access to the requested records may result in the filing of an appeal with the Records Access Appeals Officer, as well as other legal action as allowed by the FOIL law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Lexington Boa Constrictor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records created as a result of an incident concerning a boa constrictor reported in Lexington on 07/26/23, which was later revealed to be a result of a misunderstanding. The incident was widely reported in local media and on the Lexington Police Department's Facebook page. This includes, but should not be limited to:

- Recordings and/or transcripts of emergency (911) and non-emergency phone calls made to the Lexington Police Department concerning the boa constrictor

- Calls made or forwarded to Lexington's Animal Control Officer about the boa constrictor

- Any after-action reports concerning the boa constrictor

- Emails and/or text messages between the Lexington Police Department, Animal Control, and MassWildlife officials concerning the boa constrictor sighting. Please include in your search all communications between these parties containing the keywords "boa constrictor" and "snake" sent between 7 AM Tuesday, 07/25, and the date and time this request is processed.

- Emails and/or text messages sent internally within the Lexington Police Department concerning the creation of two Facebook posts regarding the boa constrictor, specifically the image included in the second Facebook post regarding the snake: https://www.facebook.com/photo/?fbid=692071839630212&set=a.270513318452735

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adrien Salzberg

communications.subject: Lexington Police Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Please find attached the records that we have on the Boa Constrictor incident that happened in Lexington, MA. There are no 911 recordings as the person that wrongly identified it as a loose snake called Mass Wildlife Officials and she was given our Animal Control officers direct line, attached is what he recorded of the conversation off of his line. Also attached are the emails/texts that were sent or received among those that were involved.


Please find attached the Public Record(s) you requested.

The attached report(s) have been redacted in part in accordance with:
                  The Massachusetts Public Records Law, Exemption C

as I believe the information clearly relates to:
The disclosure of personal data which may constitute and invasion of personal privacy

Which in this case includes specific redactions of Personal Information



You have the right to appeal this decision to the Supervisor of Records, at the address below, within 90 days from your original request.  The Appeal must include your original request along with this response.

Supervisor of Records
Office of the Secretary of the Commonwealth
McCormack Building, Room 1719
One Ashburton Place
Boston, MA  02108

You also have the right to seek judicial review of an unfavorable decision by commencing a civil action in the superior court.

Thank you,

Donna Dutton
Administrative Assistant
Lexington Police Department
Records Division
173 Bedford St.
Lexington, Ma 02420
Phone: 781-863-9284
Fax: 781-863-1291







________________________________

When writing or responding, please be aware that the Massachusetts Secretary of State has determined that most email is a public record and, therefore, may not be kept confidential.

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: 2023 roster (DMV police)
communications.communication:
Hello,

This is a request under the Vermont Public Records Act. I am seeking a roster of all sworn law enforcement officers currently at the DMV, under the Enforcement & Safety division or elsewhere. I am interested in both full- and part-time officers.

For each officer, I am seeking the following information:
- Name
- Badge or other ID number
- Rank
- Job title, if applicable
- Unit assignment, if applicable
- Start date
- Birth date (or year of birth)
- Gender
- Race or ethnicity
- 2022 salary
- 2022 overtime pay

If it is possible to provide the data in a machine-readable form, such as CSV, Excel, SQL database, etc, that is strongly preferred and greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
Brian Waters

communications.subject: FW: Vermont Public Records Act Request: 2023 roster (DMV police)
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

In response to your request, the DMV is invoking a time extension pursuant to 1 V.S.A. § 318(a)(5), which authorizes additional time when the DMV must "search for and collect the requested records from field facilities or other establishments that are separate from the office processing the request", and must " search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records which are demanded in a single request. The DMV will reply as soon as possible, but no later than 8/8/23.

Shannon Fassett | Section Manager

title: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Connecticut Office Of Early Childhood)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Child care licensing records 2019-present (Connecticut Office Of Early Childhood)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical licensing data for all licensed child care providers (active and closed) that were open anytime from 1/1/19-present:
•	Provider name or ID
•	Provider address
•	Latest license issue date and expiration date 
•	First license issue date
•	Any additional provider data that your agency collects

If electronic records from before 1/1/19 are available, I’d be happy to collect them as well.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Welcome to the Office of Early Childhood FOI Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Office of Early Childhood FOI Records Center. 
 
You may now log into the FOI Records Center to update any contact or password information.  You will so be able to monitor and track the progress the of your request and receive responsive documents. 
 Your Login ID is:  150263-53648916@requests.muckrock.com

communications.subject: FOI Records Request :: R000010-080523
communications.communication:
Dear Gabrielle Pepin: 
 
 
This message is an acknowledgement that the Connecticut Office of Early Childhood received your Freedom of Information Act request on 8/5/2023. It was given the reference number R000010-080523 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the OEC FOI Records Center. 
Connecticut Office of Early Childhood 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the OEC FOI Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HSWydu409MYGM-2B1rmDcLCyXkd-2B7LT30DCAgg4tGqiQxUVj2x2I9C5DAcG2lXTCRpCA-3D-3DtEpd_r2OHoWwyq4nZCheTPfKVSl4rTZNqrp2nC5xu8sG-2B5g410VS2xLEmbEGhJcsbyylz59lN6av2I72cbErhcEnzH7YlLXhP88ye1xYDPQdfQ5GZhOhwuw-2BspEkXFh6TQdtgBp3N6JkvKj1P-2BA-2BSzIJzQ9lmNYmXw5vcKCOZxVy4eSQXsxJcroxKaMP9DUeOfkWyFahdH8s44oDvi48VEPrldEQ9EFODbEeSBDJuH0-2BQzbUAo7GOFGFVSWWzRLgQaUAIbHnINksjJWmE0TzXOGlpLCbfRpmSDSQnbUuHCsk2G47I540KZ00-2BFVqRHsiEX-2FNI-2FQ0pU17ScgzvhtMPN3mGL475z1fP2CVPVkN-2FXSY4I1IlsUjW6-2FCLI5XPnh6yMrv1)

communications.subject: [Records Center] FOI Records Request :: R000010-080523
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOI Records Request of August 05, 2023, Reference # R000010-080523. 
Dear Gabrielle Pepin, 
We are writing in response to Freedom of Information Act Request # R000010-080523.  We have reviewed our files and determined that our agency has responsive records.  Those records have been uploaded to the GovQA portal and can be accessed here: FOI Records Request - R000010-080523 
You may also find additional information by generating a roster of licensed or license-exempt programs by using the eLicense website. There you would select Child Care Licensing Program or Youth Camp Licensing Program, choose the type of facility such as family child care home, child care center/group child care home or license-exempt. You can also select the type of information you are looking for- recently open or closed, or get a list of all active programs. These rosters will have information such as name, license number, address, phone number, email address and more. https://www.ctoec.org/licensing/look-up-providers-and-programs/  
Sincerely, 
Legal

title: Active Employees of  Morton Community College

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Active Employees of  Morton Community College
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the list of all active employees of Morton Community College, as recent as possible. These records should contain the following fields:

- First name
- Middle name
- Last name
- Suffix
- Job Title
- Department
- Supervisor
- Initial hire date
- Most recent promotion date
- Salary for 2021 or most recent fiscal year

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Berwyn FOIA Requests

communications.subject: MuckRock News/FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Dear Sir or Madam:

Morton College received your Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA" or the "Act") request on or about July 25, 2023.
The College has five (5) business days, after its receipt, to respond to your FOIA request, as stated in Section 3(d) of the Act (5 ILCS 140/3(d)). Pursuant to Section 3(e) of the Act (5 ILCS 140/3(e)), the time period for the College to respond to a FOIA request may be extended for an additional five (5) business days. The College is unable to respond to your FOIA request within five (5) business days for the following reason:

o The request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by Section 3(d) of the Act without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body. 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(vi).

On or before August 7, 2023, the College will appropriately reply to your Freedom of Information Act request. Your patience is appreciated while our department handles your request.

Sincerely,



Murneka Davis



[cid:image003.png@01D9C08C.FE744F10]

communications.subject: MuckRock News/FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Dear Sir or Madam,

Please see the attached.

Sincerely,

Murneka Davis

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: 2023 roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A roster of all current officers at the SBPD, both full- and part-time.

Please provide records sufficient to show, for each officer:
- Name

- Age or year of birth
- Gender
- Race or ethnicity

- Badge number or other ID number
- Rank
- Job title
- Unit assignment
- Start date

- 2022 salary
- 2022 overtime pay

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Waters

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FLIR THERMAL CAMERAS (San Bernardino County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – FLIR THERMAL CAMERAS (San Bernardino County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Thermal Cameras (FLIR) owned by this department or agency. Please specify if the equipment is hand-held, pole-mounted or in used in conjunction with aircraft.

 - Number, if any, of Thermal Cameras (FLIR) available for use by this department or agency via collaborative agreements that were utilized within the period encompassing this request. Please provide the name of the department or agency that made FLIR devices available to this department or agency for use.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS.


Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

In response to your request for the number, if any, of Thermal Cameras (FLIR) owned by this department or agency and if the equipment is hand-held, pole-mounted or in used in conjunction with aircraft, the Department has 12 FLIR capable aircraft mounted cameras. In response to your request for the number, if any, of Thermal Cameras (FLIR) available for use by this department or agency via collaborative agreements that were utilized within the period encompassing this request, the Department advises that there are none. In response to your request for any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS, the Department advises that there are no plans for the acquisition of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS. In response to your request for any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities, the Department is providing you with one document which may be responsive to this request. In response to your request for any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Thermal Cameras or FLIRS, the Department advises that there has been none. Sincerely, San Bernardino County Sheriff’s Department * Thermal Cameras.pdf Document links are valid for one month. # Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on
    it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    FBI files 52-96921 52-96893.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/65897/FBI20fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://www.muckrock.com/accounts/agency_login/federal-bureau-of-investigation-10/52-96921-52-96893-67004/?uuid-login=574178f0-fbf4-4d82-bd28-ed0cd10b85f2&email=foipaquestions%40ic.fbi.gov#agency-reply

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fportland-police-bureau-396%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policies-portland-police-bureau-149235%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicrecords-ppb%252540portlandoregon.gov&url_auth_token=AAAVRZz_7bWCxJSfJJE7YHy40PU%3A1qLG87%3AX4ppGww67vfQFt2z_qbFQEQnjctYnR4vFZjKtxXLjw0 
At this time, the City is uncertain whether it is the custodian of the requested record.  The City will review your request to determine if it has responsive records.  The City will then gather an estimate of the costs to provide copies of requested public records for which the City does not claim an exemption from disclosure.  The City is permitted to charge its actual costs to provide records.  Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. 
 
Please be advised that a pre-payment from you may be required.  If a pre-payment is required, you will receive a separate notice with instructions.  You may click here to access the payments page. 
 You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. Responding to individual inquires by phone or email diverts the staff from responding to requests and may further delay your receipt of records. Thank you for using the Portland Public Records Request Center. Please note that the Police Bureau is currently experiencing a significant backlog of public records requests (both electronic and hardcopy requests).  Please expect your request to take up to 4 weeks to be processed.  For status updates concerning your public records request please refer to the Portland Public Records Request Center via the link below.  While we cannot expedite every request, if you have an urgent need for the record such as a court date or an issue involving identity theft, please call the Police Bureau directly at (503) 823-0756.  Thank you for your patience.

communications.subject: You have an invoice available :: S293057-071623
communications.communication:
RE:  Public Records Request#: S293057-071623 
 
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
 
 PAYMENT DUE 
 
The City may be the custodian of at least some of the requested public records and a payment is due to continue processing this request. Please log into the Portland Public Records Request Center to pay these fees. 
 
Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. We will not be working on your request until we receive the payment. 
 
Please log in to the Portland Public Records Request Center (copy and right click this link to open it in your browser) and make a payment on this request. 
 
You may pay by electronic check or credit card by going to "My Public Records Request Center" and select "View My Invoices." Then scroll to find your open invoice and select "Make Payment." Follow the screen prompts to make a payment. 
 
Due to the current state of emergency, most City offices are not staffed. Consequently, if you mail a check it could delay the response time and it is preferable that you use the online payment portal to make an electronic payment. However, if you need to mail a check, please reply to this message and ask for the correct address. Please be sure and provide your Reference Number (S293057-071623) on your check. 
 
Please be advised that pursuant to ORS 192.329(3)(b) and (4)(b), your public records request will be closed if payment is not received within sixty (60) days of this invoice. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
City of Portland Public Records Responder 
 
 
 *Please note that you will need to disable your pop-up blocker on your browser's settings in order to make an online payment.
*Please see this Answer for more information:  A006257-010816 If you are having technical difficulties with the website, please contact the website administrator by phone or email.  (503) 823-6040 or prrhelp@portlandoregon.gov

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IPA mobility program agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All requests for certification as an eligible organization under the Intergovernmental Personnel Act mobility program submitted to your agency since Jan. 1, 2017. Organizations wishing to participate in the mobility program must first submit request for certification packets to the agency with which they seek to partner. Detailed descriptions of the IPA Mobility Program, its rules and regulations, and the documentation participating agencies must maintain can be found here: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/hiring-information/intergovernment-personnel-act/#url=Provisions.

2) A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the organizations currently approved by your agency to participate in the IPA mobility program. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide your agency's approval letter for each organization.

 3) A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the IPA mobility program assignments approved by your agency since Jan. 1, 2020. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide assignment agreement documents for each assignment. Please note: I understand and accept that some information—namely, SSN, address, DOB—would have to be redacted from the assignment agreements. It is for this reason that I've requested the records in formats that are easy to filter or redact. 

I request expedited processing of this request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II). I am a working journalist and I intend to use the requested records to "[engage] in disseminating information ... to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity."

I also ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to publish articles in the public interest and not for any commercial purpose. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of it, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation and citations to the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Dickens Cop City Intervention
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1: All communications, including written materials, text messages, emails, or messenger app messages sent or received by Mayor Andre Dickens, his Chief of Staff, and any designer who communicated with Atlanta City Council Members or their offices between 8pm on Sunday, June 4, 2023 and 11am on Tuesday, June 6, 2023. 

2. All communications (as defined in part 1 above) sent or received between the Office of the Mayor and the Atlanta Police Foundation or its designees, lobbyists, or agents during the time period described in part 1 above. 

3. All records reflecting any planning by the Mayor’s Office for the June 5 City Council meeting, including consideration of and the decision to close city offices, restrict entry of certain liquids and other materials on the day of the meeting.

4. Any electronic record maintained by Mayo Dickens created or received  during the time period list in part 1 above containing one or more of the following terms: “vote” “count” “whip” “intel” “deal” “threat” “APF” “lawsuit” “NMTC” “lose” or “win”.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Open Records Request: Dickens Cop City Intervention
communications.communication:
Good morning,

This email is in response to your open records request received on June 20, 2023 via mail. You have requested a total of four records of which Numbers 2 and 3 require additional information. I have highlighted in yellow what is needed in order to fulfill your request.

Number 2: "All communications (as defined in part 1 above) sent or received between the Office of the Mayor and the Atlanta Police Foundation or its designees, lobbyists, or agents during the time period described in part 1 above."
The Office of the Mayor has over 300 employees. Do you have a name(s) of individuals you have interest in? In regard to individuals at the Atlanta Police Foundation, I can request a hit on @atlantapolicefoundation.org. May I suggest a hit count on the following:

Emails: To and From (Specific, email Address needed); @atlantapolicefoundation.org
Timeframe: Between 8pm on Sunday, June 4, 2023 and 11am on Tuesday, June 6, 023
Keywords: vote, count, whip, intel, deal, threat, APF, lawsuit, NMTC, lose, or win

Number 3: "All records reflecting any planning by the Mayor's Office for the June 5 City Council meeting, including consideration of and the decision to close city offices, restrict entry of certain liquids and other materials on the date of the meeting."
This request would require a citywide email search. May I suggest a hit count on the following:

Emails: To and From (Specific Email Address needed);
Timeframe: Between 8pm on Sunday, June 4, 2023 and 11am on Tuesday, June 6, 023
Keywords: "June 5 City Council Meeting"; "close city offices", "restrict entry"

Let me know if you would like to proceed with the aforementioned suggestions. In the interim, our office is currently working on Numbers 1 and 4.  You should expect to hear back from our office by Monday, June 26, 2023.
Regards,

Kimberly

communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

This email is in response to Number 1 of your request for the following:

Emails: To and from ADickens@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:ADickens@AtlantaGa.Gov>; Odie@atlantaGA.gov<mailto:Odie@atlantaGA.gov> ;  mbond@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:mbond@AtlantaGa.Gov>; kwaites@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:kwaites@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; jwinston@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:jwinston@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; arfarokhi@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:arfarokhi@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; bdamos@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:bdamos@AtlantaGa.Gov>; jdozier@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:jdozier@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; lbakhtiari@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:lbakhtiari@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; awan@atlantaga.gov<mailto:awan@atlantaga.gov> ; dshipman@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:dshipman@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; DRHillis@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:DRHillis@AtlantaGa.Gov>; ABoone@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:ABoone@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; mcoverstreet@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:mcoverstreet@AtlantaGa.Gov> ; anlewis@AtlantaGa.Gov<mailto:anlewis@AtlantaGa.Gov>
Timeframe: Between 8:00 p.m. Sunday, June 4, 2023 and 11:00 a.m. Tuesday, June 6, 2023
Keywords: “vote”, “count”, “whip”, “intel”, “deal”, “threat”, “APF”, “lawsuit”, “NMTC”, “lose”, or “win”

Following the performance of a preliminary search of its email records, the Executive Office has identified approximately 1,230 potentially responsive emails. Prior to the release, each email must be reviewed to determine whether it is responsive and to ensure that it does not include any information which is exempt from production in accordance with the Georgia Open Records Act, including but not limited to that which is exempt from production under the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine (OCGA Secs. 50-18-72(a)(41) and (a)(42)). This review is estimated to take approximately 4.1 hours at a rate of 300 emails reviewed per hour.

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act

the charge for the search, retrieval, or redaction of records shall not exceed the prorated hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee who,
in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the request.

OCGA Sec. 50-18-71(b)(1)(A)

The hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee of the Department of the Executive Offices, who in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the actions necessary to complete the search retrieval and redaction of the emails which are not estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine is $18.00 per hour.  It is estimated that it will take this employee 2.7 hours to complete their review and redaction of the emails which are not estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine.

The hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee of the Department of Law, who in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the actions necessary to complete the search, retrieval, and redaction of the emails is $37.02 per hour.  It is estimated that it will take this employee 1.35 hours to complete their review and redaction of the emails which are estimated to contain information subject to the attorney/client privilege or the attorney-work product doctrine.

Accordingly, we estimate that the cost to complete the search, retrieval, and redaction of the records which you have requested to be $98.57. Upon your agreement to move forward, we will provide you with payment instructions.

Alternatively, feel free to modify your request to reduce cost.
Regards,

Kimberly

Andrew

title: Migrants deaths and remains found (Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Migrants deaths and remains found (Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. Specifically, I am seeking access to the following information regarding migrant remains that have been documented in your Medical Examiner Officer or County Sheriff's files for fiscal years 2017 - 2022:

Age
Sex
Body condition
Coordinates where the body was located
Country of origin
Cause of death

I understand that these records may contain sensitive information, and I assure you that any information provided will be used solely for legitimate research purposes.

Please inform me of any fees associated with this request, and I would be happy to provide payment if necessary. Additionally, please let me know if there are any limitations on the amount of information that can be provided, or if you require any further information from me in order to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriela Villegas

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Sheriff Data Collection Request (2016-2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year, from 2016-2021 (for example, 302 use of force incidents in 2019, 287 use of force incidents in 2020, etc.)

2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used from 2020-2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2020, baton incidents in 2020, etc.). Please include as part of this a breakdown of how many use of force incidents in each year were related to law enforcement operations and how many were related to correctional/custodial operations.

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P034208-011623
communications.communication:
Dear Samuel: 
 
Your request has been logged in WebQA and has been given the reference number P034208-011623 for tracking purposes. 
 
Clark County should receive your request today, except if today is a holiday or weekend, in which case receipt will be on the next business day.  You should receive a response from Clark County within five business days of their receipt that: (1) provides records; (2) provides an internet address allowing you to access records; (3) acknowledges your request and provides a reasonable estimate of the time required to respond to the request; or (4) denies the request. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. 
 
Clark County, WA

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all License Plate Reader Permits (OPER 1051 forms) completed by your agency from September 1, 2021 to the date of this request (July 28, 2023).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.communication:
This letter is in response to your Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request received by the Illinois Department of Transportation.  The Department conducted a search and found document(s) responsive to your request.  The responsive document(s) are attached.  Please be advised that certain information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(b), which exempts private information.  The information redacted contains signatures, which are a unique identifier and therefore private.

If you consider anything in this response to be an unwarranted denial of your FOIA request, you have the right to submit a request for review by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General to:

Public Access Counselor
Office of the Attorney General
500 South 2nd Street
Springfield, IL 62706
Fax: 217-782-1396
E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us<mailto:publicaccess@atg.state.il.us>

If you choose to submit a request for review, you must do so within 60 days after the date of this response letter. The request for review must be in writing, signed by you, and include a copy of your FOIA request and this office's response. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). In addition, you have the right to seek judicial review of this response. 5 ILCS 140/11(a),(b).

Barb Smith
Illinois Department of Transportation
FOIA Officer, Room 317
2300 S. Dirksen Parkway
Springfield, IL 62764
Office: 217-782-5633
Barbara.j.smith2@illinois.gov<mailto:Barbara.j.smith2@illinois.gov>
Dot.foiaofficer@illinois.gov<mailto:Dot.foiaofficer@illinois.gov>



State of Illinois - CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The information contained in this communication is confidential, may be attorney-client privileged or attorney work product, may constitute inside information or internal deliberative staff communication, and is intended only for the use of the addressee. Unauthorized use, disclosure or copying of this communication or any part thereof is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately by return e-mail and destroy this communication and all copies thereof, including all attachments. Receipt by an unintended recipient does not waive attorney-client privilege, attorney work product privilege, or any other exemption from disclosure.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: C. Boyden Gray
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Clayland Boyden Gray. Mr. Gray was a lawyer and diplomat who served as White House Counsel from 1989 to 1993 and as U.S. Ambassador to the European Union from 2006 to 2007. He was born on 6 February 1943 in Winston-Salem, NC, USA. He died on 21 May 2023.

PROOF OF DEATH
Obituaries for Mr. Gray appeared in numerous national media, including the New York Times, https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/21/obituaries/c-boyden-gray-dead.html and the Washington Post, https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/05/21/c-boyden-gray-white-house-counsel-president-ghw-bush-dies-80/.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Gray:

(1) President George Herbert Walker Bush, to whom the subject served as White House Counsel
(2) Chief Justice Earl Warren, to whom the subject was a law clerk
(3) The Atlantic Counsel, on whose board the subject served
(4) The European Institute, on whose board the subject served
(5) FreedomWorks, on whose board the subject served
(6) The Federalist Society, of which the subject was a member

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER

I respectfully request that all fees related to this request be waived.

Public Interest Factors:

1. The subject of the request must concern identifiable operations or activities of the Federal Government. My request satisfies this factor because it seeks records created or maintained by the FBI.

2. The records must be likely to contribute to the understanding of the subject of the request. My request satisfies this factor because Mr. Gray has recently died, so the Bureau may now be able to release records that were not previously available via the FOIA/PA.

3. The disclosure must contribute to the understanding of the public—meaning a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject—as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. My request satisfies this factor because Mr. Gray was a public figure. He served as White House Counsel to George H. W. Bush and was the U.S. Ambassador to the European Union. News obituaries for Mr. Gray appeared in the New York Times, the Washington Post, and other national media. Thus, a broad audience of persons will likely be interested in the records I seek. I will also make any records available online for free via muckrock.com, a FOIA-and-journalism site that lets people share the results of their FOIA requests and encourages journalism around them.

4. The public's understanding must be enhanced by the disclosure to a significant extent. My request likely satisfies this factor because Mr. Gray has recently died—meaning that the Bureau can now release responsive records that it could not have released until now. Given Mr. Gray's government service as a high-level advisor and employee in the executive and judicial branches, the public's understanding of Mr. Gray, his work, and the work of the government will likely be enhanced significantly.

Commercial Interest Factors

1. The existence and magnitude of a commercial interest: I have no commercial interest whatsoever in these records; I am just an inquisitive citizen. Thus, this factor cuts in favor of a fee waiver.

2. The primary interest in disclosure, i.e., whether disclosure is primarily in the commercial interest of the requester: I have zero commercial interest in disclosure, therefore the public interest outweighs my (nonexistent) private interest.

Conclusion:

On balance, all of the Bureau's regulatory factors tilt decisively in favor of granting me a fee waiver. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you anticipate that those fees will exceed $25.

Thank you for your timely attention to this request.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1593177-000
communications.communication:
Dear OIP:

I hearby appeal the Bureau's denial of my request for a fee waiver for my FOIPA Request No. 1593177-000 .

1. The Bureau states that my request failed to meet at least one of the four public interest factors, but it does not say which factor or factors I failed to satisfy or why. This alone is reason enough to reverse the Bureau's decision, because it makes it impossible for the requestor to meaningfully respond to the denial—rendering the denial arbitrary and capricious, an abuse of discretion, and a denial of due process.

2. My request meets the legal standard for a fee waiver. The subject of the request was a public figure, with news obituaries of his death appearing in major newspapers, including the New York Times and the Washington Post. Responsive records will be of great interest to historians, political scientists, scholars, the legal academy, and many others. I am making this request via MuckRock.com, which will automatically make all responsive records available to the general public for free. There is simply no reason to deny this fee waiver.

3. I incorporate by reference the additional arguments I made in my initial request for a fee waiver.

Thank you for your consideration of this appeal.

Most sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Aramark invoices
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide the following:

1) Copies of all invoices from Aramark from July 1, 2022 to current.

2) Copies of records of payments by CPS/Chicago Board of Education to Aramark. I want the actual bills as well as proof of payment by the district.

3) Any and all letters of engagement between CPS/Chicago Board of Education and Aramark.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N013970-072423
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

07/25/2023 

Miriam Bhimani 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR149853 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Miriam: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N013970-072423 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x ) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x ) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
(x ) there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request 
Sincerely, 

Ana Diaz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

All records related to AdventHealth also known as Adventist Health System from 2016 to 2023 with respect to contracts and legal documents and within your agency's possession, the City of Orlando. If this produces results in excess of 200, please let me know and I will revise the criteria.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I grant permission for fees up to $30. If the fees are still in excess of $30, please let me know and I will further revise the criteria. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon
Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): requests@muckrock.com
Daytime: (617) 299-1832
For mailed responses, please address:
MuckRock
185 Beacon St. #3
Somerville, MA 02143

communications.subject: Your Walla Walla County public records request #23-382 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Walla Walla County ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-382 has been submitted successfully. This letter serves as Walla Walla County’s initial five-day letter, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, to your public records request. After your request is reviewed for content and we determine the department or office in which your request refers to, the County will provide an estimate to provide an initial installment of responsive records. After locating responsive records, the County will determine whether any of the responsive documents are subject to applicable exemptions under the Public Records Act, and to notify any third parties affected by the request. If third party notification is required, twenty (20) business days will be allowed for a response by the third party to those records which specifically pertain to them. As records are reviewed, they may be released on an installment basis. Additionally, the Washington Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and Walla Walla County Policy 7.4.3.1 (BoCC Resolution #17-249) now allow the County to charge for provision of electronic records. Refer to the hyperlinked documents for the fee schedule for future records installments. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Walla Walla County portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Walla Walla County through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Walla Walla County.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: NYSID contract (Workers Compensation Board, New York State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Contract C140344 between the Workers' Compensation Board and New York State Industries for the Disabled Inc

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

Dear Sam Mellins, The Workers' Compensation Board (Board) received a public records request from you on May 25, 2023. Your request mentioned: Contract C140344 between the Workers' Compensation Board and New York State Industries for the Disabled Inc The Board has reviewed its files and has located records responsive to your request. Please log in to GovQA at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. F000180 - 052523  At the above link, please find the contract you requested. The Board has made redactions to this document, due to the substantial competitive harm and/or threat to information technology assets that would occur to Xerox, Inc, Conduent, Inc., and/or New York State Industries for the Disabled, Inc. if the contract was disclosed in full ( see POL §§  87[2][d] and [i]; 89[5][b]). To the extent that you deem any portion of this response to your FOIL request to be a denial, it may be appealed pursuant to POL § 89(4) to the Board’s Executive Director at 328 State Street, Room 438, Schenectady, New York 12305. In all future correspondence relating to this request, please refer to the above FOIL Number.  Thank you. -Brian Brian Hamm

title: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Jeffrey S. Broome, Chief Legal Officer of AdventHealth Corporate (Bar Number: 66594)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Paul Prather of Littler Mendelson P.C. (Law Firm)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., or the Freedom of Information Act and Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, whichever applies herein. I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Jeffrey S. Bromme (Bar Number: 66594) in his professional capacity as an attorney, he is an employee of AdventHealth as Chief Legal Officer and is a member of the Florida Bar, from 2010 to 2023 (present day).  In the event that this request is overly broad or produces results in excess of 100, please let me know and I will clarify further.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request, though I grant permission for fees up to $25. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. I request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs. If that is not possible, I prefer a CD-ROM or a USB drive as a secondary alternative.

I would also appreciate an approximate time frame for this request to  be processed.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

title: List of banned persons from the Texas State Capitol grounds (Texas Department Of Public Safety)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: List of banned persons from the Texas State Capitol grounds (Texas Department Of Public Safety)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of the full names of all persons who have been banned (or are in the process of being banned) from any part of the Texas State Capitol grounds for any amount of time that is between the moments of December 2nd 1998 04:53:56 CST and May 5th 2023 11:55:20 CST. For each person also include the starting and ending date and time for which they are banned. If a person is banned permanently just include the starting date and time that they were banned.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

blake griffith

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - AdventHealth
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

All records related to AdventHealth also known as Adventist Health System from 2016 to 2023 with respect to contracts and legal documents and within your agency's possession, the City of Daytona Beach.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I grant permission for fees up to $30. If the fees are still in excess of $30, please let me know as well as the number of results produced and I will further revise the criteria. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

title: Public Records Request - Health and Mental Healthcare in FLDOC

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request - Health and Mental Healthcare in FLDOC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records: 

I am requesting copies of public records regarding health and behavioral health service delivery in youth correctional facilities in your jurisdiction, to inform a comparative research project regarding health and mental health care delivery in [adult] correctional detention facilities across the US. Specifically, I request information regarding the following:

1. Name and contact details for those responsible for health and behavioral health services provisions at all locations where adults are incarcerated within your jurisdiction.
2. Regulations, policies and procedures that govern the operation of health and behavioral health provision for juveniles incarcerated within your jurisdiction. This includes health intake, room confinement, medication management,  access to specialist and dental services, discharge planning services, and other health and behavioral health related policies.
3. Contracts from January 1, 2021 to the time the request is filled between your agency and any healthcare provider including both physical health and behavioral health. 
4. Records concerning your jurisdiction’s most recent application to Centre for Medicaid Services (CMS) for an 1115 Medicaid waiver (if applicable), and any response, with specifically focus on how and whether such a waiver applies to provision of Medicaid funded services for adult inmates.
5. Records relating to financing for health and behavioral health care delivery in your jurisdiction. 

I request the records be provided electronically. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the administration of the adult justice. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than allowed by statute, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies of the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon

If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than allowed by statute, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies of the requested records. 

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 

Thank you for considering my request. 

Sincerely, 

Bailey Pillon

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Eugene Norman Yulish (June 9, 1931 – January 19, 2020), known as Gene London, who was the host of a long-running, Philadelphia local children's television show, Cartoon Corners (a.k.a. The Gene London Show).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously
    written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over
    100,000
    readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the
    People,
    Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable
    expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well
    established. In
    addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available
    through
    non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock,
    disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to
    this, a great
    deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the
    government itself.
    As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this
    particular
    subject in advance.
    Further, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information
    to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch,
    Inc. v. Dep’t of
    Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of
    Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified
    because it also
    had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning
    United States
    foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I
    qualify as a member of
    the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the
    requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made
    by” a
    representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper
    reporter, for
    example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much
    interest there is
    in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the
    details of the
    request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee
    category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and
    making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

Documentation Files

# Deceased Individual

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix ARN SSN FBI Number Date of
Birth Place of Birth Date of Death Additional Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:

    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look

    Sincerely,
    
    Emma Best

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CPRA Request: Fisher
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All metadata for email communications sent or received, including being CCed or BBCed, by Jake Fisher between the dates of 7/1/2022 and 4/28/2023 and at least one of the following keywords: "Flock", "American Rescue Plan", "Asset Forfeiture" or "gunshot detection".

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if the email has an attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e
